{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3156488,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-03T11:48:48.369Z","cooked":"

R405 prohibits ‚ÄúBUMPER markings‚Äù, listing four exceptions: required team numbers; hook & loop, snap fasteners, & equivalents; FIRST logos; and stray bits of exposed fabric at seams and edges.
R409, particularly Figure 9-7, shows metal angle on top of the fabric - in the ‚Äúhard parts zone‚Äù.
Is this angle depicted in R409 required to be red/blue as appropriate to comply with R405, or is it an implicit fifth exception to R405? Is there any problem if the metal is painted or powder coated or anodized something other than the bumper color? If this angle is also part of the bumper fastener system, does this change the answer?

If I had Q&A access, I would have posted that myself. If anyone would be kind enough to do so, that would be awesome. Yes, it came up at inspection yesterday.

Not an inspector but I don‚Äôt think they are considering the angle brackets from the inside of the bumpers to the frame ‚ÄúVisible Markings‚Äù even though from some angles you can see them.

From the intent of the rules no one is going to be confused by the brackets on the inside. Most refs will not even be able to see them. They want the team number and alliance to be clear and unambiguous when looking at the robot on the field playing the game.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-03-03T11:58:07.658Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":391,"readers_count":390,"score":98.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":428772,"topic_slug":"bumpers-2023-apparent-conflict-between-r405-and-r408-fig-9-7-2023","display_username":"Brad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38557,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector "},"post_url":"/t/bumpers-2023-apparent-conflict-between-r405-and-r408-fig-9-7-2023/428772/2","custom_user_title":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3156494,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-03T12:00:15.750Z","cooked":"

The part of the angle facing the frame perimeter is not considered ‚Äúdisplayed‚Äù per the R405 blue box. I am referring to the upward facing part of the angle. Honestly, my hope and expectation is that this will become a fifth exception, or perhaps an expansion of exception B or a blue box clarification to one of the rules. The brackets I looked at yesterday were upward facing. If they were downward facing, I wouldn‚Äôt have noticed because they aren‚Äôt displayed in a practical sense, but the same rule appears to apply either way. The team (a long experienced team) asked me to point to the rule. I pointed to R405. They accepted my call and applied some paint pens to these brackets, and were done by the time I finished the rest of the inspection (they weren‚Äôt all along the frame perimeter). I later mentioned it to my LRI, and he indicated that R408 overruled R405. In this case it wasn‚Äôt a big big deal, but I would like this to either solidly be or not be a deal going forward.

They way I read R405 and R408 I would not consider these brackets as ‚Äúmarkings‚Äù referenced in R405. It would not have crossed my mind during inspection to make the team paint the brackets.

I have to wonder if the color of the brackets that are showing is really something a team should be worried about during inspection. I don‚Äôt think I ever would have read the rules to think it meant brackets should be painted bumper color and is just making it hard on the team in question.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-03-03T18:26:04.920Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":143,"readers_count":142,"score":28.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":428772,"topic_slug":"bumpers-2023-apparent-conflict-between-r405-and-r408-fig-9-7-2023","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":9303,"username":"Tim708","name":"Tim James","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tim708/{size}/189359_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3564,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1768 Drive Coach "},"post_url":"/t/bumpers-2023-apparent-conflict-between-r405-and-r408-fig-9-7-2023/428772/5","custom_user_title":"1768 Drive Coach ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3156744,"name":"ChuckDickerson","username":"ChuckDickerson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/e79b87/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-03T22:08:12.064Z","cooked":"

The metal angle for clamping fabric is not a ‚Äúmarking‚Äù nor is there any requirement that it be any matching color to the fabric (red/blue). There is no need for teams to worry about the color of the metal angle/brackets. There is no conflict between R405 and R408.
